title: THE AIR JORDAN 2 WILL GET DECONSTRUCTED THIS SUMMER
author: fomichev
content: The Air Jordan 2 doesn’t get as much love as it truly deserves. The shoes were universally panned at the time of its original release, but it opened doors for Nike to get sexier with leather materials and animal-print textures, which is the standard for today’s higher-end retro product offerings. This Summer, Jordan Brand will present the Air Jordan 2 Decon, a slimmed-down version of the 1987 silhouette.By removing the excess padding, the Air Jordan 2 Decon is obviously much slimmer on feet and lends to the dominant casual/lifestyle trend. Color-blocking options appear to be the usual tonal style; seen here is a mint and Bordeaux while an unseen “Sail” colorway is coming as well. Expect a release in July with a $150 MSRP.
summary: The Air Jordan 2 doesn’t get as much love as it truly deserves. The shoes were universally panned at the time of its original release, but it opened doors for Nike to get sexier with leather materials and animal-print textures, which is the standard for today’s higher-end retro product offerings. title: TOP STORIES OF THE WEEK: APRIL 1-7
author: fomichev
content: It was another eventful week in the sneaker industry, with everything from amazing new sneakers unveiled by adidas to The Rock’s signature shoe from Under Armour to a bit of controversy in the retail realm making headlines. Chances are you missed at least a couple of the major stories throughout the week, so we’re here with a handy recap of the last seven days in sneaker news. Check it all out below.

Chances are you missed at least a couple of the major stories throughout the week, so we’re here with a handy recap of the last seven days in sneaker news. Check it all out below.

title: THIS DIADORA N.9000 IS INSPIRED BY THE CLASSIC TV DETECTIVE COLUMBO
author: fomichev
content: Taking inspiration from an unlikely source, Diadora creates a new colorway of the N.9000 modeled after the classic TV detective Columbo. Don’t know who Columbo is? Go ask your grandparents, because they were definitely watching the show starring the wily Los Angeles homicide detective back in the day. The shoe features a khaki suede and leather upper referencing his signature trench coat and his basset hound “Dog” depicted on each tongue. Investigate the photo evidence of the Diadora N.9000 “Columbo” here, and track down your own pair at select Diadora retailers now.
summary: Taking inspiration from an unlikely source, Diadora creates a new colorway of the N.9000 modeled after the classic TV detective Columbo. Don’t know who Columbo is? Go ask your grandparents, because they were definitely watching the show starring the wily Los Angeles homicide detective back in the day. The shoe features a khaki suede and leather upper referencing his signature trench coat and his basset hound “Dog” depicted on each tongue. Investigate the photo evidence of the Diadora N.9000 “Columbo” here, and track down your own pair at select Diadora retailers now.

title: AIR JORDAN 11 LOW “UNC” RELEASING IN SUMMER 2017
author: fomichev
content: The Air Jordan 11 Low “UNC” is expected to release on April 15th, 2017 for $175. Tar Heel fans, rejoice. Jordan Brand loves paying tribute to Michael Jordan’s alma mater, the University of North Carolina, with shoutouts to the school in the form of University Blue accents on a number of Jordan retros in years past. Now the Air Jordan 11 Low UNC is finally returning in retro this summer.The summertime is always when the Air Jordan 11 Low thrives, and the Air Jordan 11 Low UNC will return at the perfect time, over 16 years after the patent leather gem featuring Columbia Blue debuted at retailers in 2001. A little bit has changed since =the original, as an updated blue tint can be expected to hit the icy outsole unit to match the UNC shade on the mudguard. Of course, this year’s rendition comes with a slight alteration in the particular shade of blue, as the original “Columbia Blue” is now known as “University Blue”. Are you excited about the return of the Air Jordan 11 Low UNC?Check out more detailed photos below and be sure to head over to our always-updated Air Jordan Release Dates page for more info.
summary: The Air Jordan 11 Low “UNC” is expected to release on April 15th, 2017 for $175. Tar Heel fans, rejoice. title: RECAP FUTURE’S POP-UP EVENT WITH REEBOK AND THE INSTAPUMP FURY
author: fomichev
content: The Instapump Fury took center stage for Reebok classic last week, with a special pop-up shop event in New York City. Not only was the forever-bold shoe itself on display and for sale, but its new endorser and rap superstar Future was on hand to help promote the event. Ahead of his stop on tour at Barclay’s Center in Brooklyn last Tuesday, Future was in the big city to make a special appearance at the Reebok Instapump Fury pop-up in Manhattan. If you couldn’t make it, luckily Reebok has you covered with a recap video showing the space and discussing the importance of the Fury, which you can watch below.

Not only was the forever-bold shoe itself on display and for sale, but its new endorser and rap superstar Future was on hand to help promote the event. Ahead of his stop on tour at Barclay’s Center in Brooklyn last Tuesday, Future was in the big city to make a special appearance at the Reebok Instapump Fury pop-up in Manhattan. title: Reebok Releases Insta Pump Fury “Splatter” Pack for Summer
author: titivuk
content: Reebok has released the latest iteration of the Insta Pump Fury just in time for the last days of summer. Forging two-tone retro color palettes against speckled encasing, the “Splatter” pack provides a a summer-friendly aesthetic while presenting a timely theme all at once. Optioned in two distinct styles, the two colorways available are “Grey/Indigo/Royal” and “Black/Grey/Glass Green.”
summary: Reebok has released the latest iteration of the Insta Pump Fury just in time for the last days of summer. Forging two-tone retro color palettes against speckled encasing, the “Splatter” pack provides a a summer-friendly aesthetic while presenting a timely theme all at once. Optioned in two distinct styles, the two colorways available are “Grey/Indigo/Royal” and “Black/Grey/Glass Green.”

title: IS AN OFF WHITE X AIR JORDAN 1 COLLABORATION RELEASING?
author: titivuk
content: Virgil Abloh’s OFF WHITE imprint is going to be a major player on the Nike Sportswear collaborative front for the next couple of seasons. Not only have we seen multiple early samples of the Air Force 1 featuring literally “Everything In Quotes” to label the intricate constructions of the classic silhouette, but the Nike Blazer has also appeared revitalized from the fashion imprint. But those will pale in comparison to what’s next: an OFF WHITE Air Jordan 1 collaboration. After Hiroshi Fujiwara touched the 1985 grail with his fragment 1s, it doesn’t look like the Air Jordan 1 Retro High is off-limits on the collaborative front anymore, and this OFF WHITE Jordan 1 is the craziest concept we’ve seen yet. The Air Jordan 1 “Chicago” colorway serves as the base, while the medial side Swoosh is ditched entirely (you can still see the original perforations) for an OFF WHITE branded stamp of approval featuring Beaverton, Oregon and the year the model initially came to be: 1985. Check out a brief look at the OFF WHITE Air Jordan 1 sample below, and we’ll keep you updated if this pair will actually release right here on Sneaker News. In the meantime, head over to our Jordan Release Dates page for more updates.
summary: Virgil Abloh’s OFF WHITE imprint is going to be a major player on the Nike Sportswear collaborative front for the next couple of seasons. But those will pale in comparison to what’s next: an OFF WHITE Air Jordan 1 collaboration. title: THE NIKE AIR FOAMPOSITE ONE "COPPER" RELEASES ON APRIL 17TH
author: titivuk
content: he “Heaven Cent” colorway of the Nike Air Foamposite One is back, much to the delight of fans of the shoe everywhere. Easily one of the best colorways for Penny Hardaway’s shoe ever, the penny-colored Foams are back for the first time ever since they originally released in 2010. Seven years later, the Air Foamposite One “Copper” will be looking just as good as ever when they drop on April 17th (previously slated for a 4/20 release date) at select Nike Sportswear retailers everywhere, including Rock City Kicks.
summary: he “Heaven Cent” colorway of the Nike Air Foamposite One is back, much to the delight of fans of the shoe everywhere.
